title: add and improve test targets
body: see also 'validate html in tests' #87

title: validate html in tests
body: It appears that BBEdit's HTML validation might now work in a scripted call. If that does not work, look into HTML validators on GitHub.

title: Doxygen docsets
body:
The code to produce a Doxygen docset has been broken for some time. The method executes it return zero prior to attempting to run the docset code.
For now, we can view our documentation from Safari. However, to link from our code to its documentation, we need a docset available for Dash.

- [x] for recursive copy, change `cp -r` to `cp -R`, now recommended for portability
- [x] change `/Users/$USER' to `${HOME}` for AppCode compatibility

After these changes, several problems with building the docset remain:
- The `tar` call in the generated makefile fails; editing the file to use `bsdtar` does make the script run without failures.
    - *This problem may have been caused by tampering with the `/usr/bin/tar` alias when we were working on setting up gnu-tar.*
- When we have gotten it to run, it appears to have produced either documentation files or a proper index, but not both, and sometimes generates many errors.

title: DeveloperTests failure
body:
DeveloperTests fail on inaccurate error code.

execInstallScript: return correct value on command completion

title: customize doxygen output
body:
- add date to doxygen output
- see [Header, Footer, and Stylesheet changes] (http://www.stack.nl/~dimitri/doxygen/manual/customize.html#minor_tweaks_header_css); [Current date in doxygen documentation C++ header](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26564454/current-date-in-doxygen-documentation-c-header)

title: korn shell trace
body: live templates to handle ksh trace see [current line number in shell script](http://www.unix.com/shell-programming-and-scripting/131065-current-line-number-shell-script.html) - [ ] replbold: `([^<]*)` - [ ] withstring: `$1` also: - [ ] settrace: `export PS4='$0 $LINENO >>'; set -x` - [ ] unsettrace: `set +x`

title: website to new host by March 17
body:
GoDaddy has just implemented a new hosting system that will eventually replace the existing host. We need to get our website transferred so the old website can be released by March 17.

In connection with this change, we are now hosting LaurasCelloStudio.com.

- [x] upgrade Transmit
- [x] temporarily post our current site on Laura's site
- [x] then post site at our same address, but on the new host
- [x] cancel our subscription to the original site
- --- *March 17* ---
- continue #81

title: Waffle css
body:
Waffle's display of headers is very different from GitHub's. That's confusing, and we find the header styles difficult to interpret.

Add style WaffleIssue.css; use as needed to format headers. We could at least put a style definition in the issue content when we need it.

title: Continuous Integration
body:
Continuous integration is available both through Xcode and through IntelliJ TeamCity. We have tried Xcode's, and were not impressed. The reviews we found all emphatically suggest that TeamCity is much better.

 It appears that TeamCity can be set up in a reasonable amount of time on an external hard drive connected to the development computer.

See [TeamCity Documentation] (https://confluence.jetbrains.com/display/TCD9/TeamCity+Documentation)

##### **document tools and installation (Tools.html) throughout**
- [ ] add LiveTemplate  toolsItem

##### **Java**
- [x] update to java 8; see [Tools: Java](http://candcsoft.com/TechnicalDocs/Support/Tools.html#_Java)
- *There is information available to fix problems caused by Xcode setting itself to the front of `$PATH`, forcing use of Xcode/bsd tools; see [How to switch JDK version on Mac OS X](http://www.jayway.com/2014/01/15/how-to-switch-jdk-version-on-mac-os-x-maverick/). For now, we use standalone Terminal with Xcode, and embedded Terminal with AppCode, so we expect that this will not be needed and would rather not risk tripping up Xcode.*

##### **gnu tar**
*specified by TeamCity installation due to problems with BSD (Xcode's) tar*
- [ ] switch to from bsdtar to gnu-tar; see [Tools: tar](http://candcsoft.com/TechnicalDocs/Support/Tools.html#_Tar)

##### **TeamCity initial installation**
- see [Installing and Configuring the TeamCity Server](https://confluence.jetbrains.com/display/TCD9/Installing+and+Configuring+the+TeamCity+Server#InstallingandConfiguringtheTeamCityServer-InstallingTeamCitybundledwithTomcatservletcontainer(Linux,MacOSX,Windows))
- see also blog post [How to Install Team City](http://www.gep13.co.uk/blog/how-to-install-teamcity/), with links to MySQL installation
- [ ] get rough estimate of storage allocation
    - volume previously named 'vacant' @ 637GB; renamed to 'TeamCity'
- [ ] remove previous tries
- [ ] get gnu tar

...
- [ ] test TeamCity installation
- [ ] install auto-start script
- [ ] tentative  decision on storage allocation

##### **Upgrade to External Database**

title: continue AppCode/Waffle development

milestone.title: AppCode / Waffle
milestone.description:
We said: Support AppCode, and possibly other tools as indicated, as we continue work on Accessor while trying to keep development under better control.

And then we found Waffle.

Adopt AppCode and Waffle.

body:
Slates, Workflow documentation need continuing development as we go forward.

- [x] Support: remove project Support. Its purpose was to create target all tests, but that did not work. Now, AppCode wants to open the project instead of the workspace.
- [x] update Workflow

---
##### **02/27/26**
- *We are happy with the product combination and its workflow.
However, we had some major issues as we set it up.
These are probably due to having it take a while to figure out how the new development workflow needed to fit with git.*
    - *Our local git repository was corrupted and needed to be replaced.*
    - *Our workspace, involving at least one project inside it, consistently crashed Xcode and needed to be rebuilt.*
    - *We misunderstood what AppCode was doing with checkout stashes that it made, resulting in a stash that was so old and large that we lacked confidence that we could correctly resolve the stash.*

*We plan to:*
- *save/build the files that we intend to be active following this fix*
- *use `reset --hard HEAD` to return to commit 15901c7*
- *use the saved files to reconstruct the work  from there*
- *see also [Updated Git but still showing old version](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20508136/updated-git-but-still-showing-old-version)*

##### **make folder containing the desired state**
- [x] git rev-list to get list of commits since 15901c7; print with logs
    - `git rev-list --all --since '2015-11-11' | xargs git show --name-only >> $out`
- [x] save copy of Support, which is the starting point for constructing the target state, to SupportRewindStart
    - *also periodically save additional SupportRewindN files as work proceeds*
- [x] Existing Stashes: apply any changes we want to keep
- [x] Starting with the most recent, diff back chronologically through recent commits since 15901c7, saving in any changes from previous versions that we want to keep. Continue until no changes for awhile.
    - *Ignore Xcode scheme and AppCode configuration files. These should be rebuilt manually.*
- [x] ***SAVE*** copy of final Support directory as SupportTarget

##### **go back to commit 15901c7**
- [x] `reset --hard ` to commit 15901c7
- [x] synchronize with remote tracking branch and local master

##### **restore changes**
- [x] copy the files we kept/changed (visible files only) from SupportTarget to Support_Changed&New
- [x] test all targets in Xcode
- [ ] rebuild using Support_Changed&New
    - Cdoc; scripts; targets; file templates; pyparsing; finish up (misc adds, deletes)

##### **revert**
*It is now obvious that the `reset` above was wrong because commits had been published to the repository on GitHub.*
- [x] revert from where we are now back to 15901c7
- [x] get all targets working in Xcode
    - *at least at this point, it was an Xcode issue causing them to fail*
- [x] apply previously-saved stashes to collect-all-changes-#71
- [x] shell scripts have explicit return values
    - In Xcode, any active error is automatically returned. Apparently, AppCode differs in this regard, resulting in situations where the Run panel correctly shows an error, but the event log shows a successful build.
- [x] ensure stashes do not contain code we need
- [x] remove obsolete files (pyparsing; Support.bbprojectd; Support.xcodeproj; Developer/CCDevTry1)
- [x] recover Xcode Unit Testing Templates
- [x] set up AppCode targets
 
##### **continuing**
*Hopefully, we can continue successfully from here. We do expect a discontinuity in the history at15901c7*

title: use PyCharm for python development
body:
Getting Started:
    - [PyCharm: Getting Started](https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/documentation/?gclid=CjwKEAiA3Ou1BRDso5XyhduuwFASJABP3PEDOrRzGBwPeK35nSXrX8_Rf75pvoInNEl_dtpcKltGdhoCcOXw_wcB&gclsrc=aw.ds&dclid=CNLg9f7d7soCFZNBMAodR60EbQ)

    - [Can I use Python as a bash replacement?](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/209470/can-i-use-python-as-a-bash-replacement) *StackOverflow*
- [ ] In PyCharm,  try opening the existing Python directory and running it's tests. If that works well, go from there. If not,  remove the extra idea folder,  create new empty project Support/Developer/DevPython, and go from there.

body:
- [ ] improve github backup
    - [x] ghubUtil: make output headings appear more clearly
    - see [Linux echo colors](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5947742/how-to-change-the-output-color-of-echo-in-linux)
   - [ ] TDD devBackup.py to replace functionality of ghubUtil.ksh
    - [ ] add folder GitHub inside Other Documents; move backup data there
    - [ ] add each repo's wiki for backup next to issues
        - see [github-backup gist](https://gist.github.com/rodw/3073987)
    - [ ] back up and tar each repository to /Archives
- [ ] Support target AppCode
    - [ ] add AppCode target AppCode to contain settings
    - [ ] add AppCode files from ~/Library/Preferences and ~/Library/Application Support to target Support/AppCode
        - *store Tasks  with their project*
        - `ls -(t?)d ~/Library/Preferences/AppCode* | head -n 1` with `for f in $(ls -d AppCode*); do; echo $f; done`
        - see [How to copy a directory or folder](http://www.computerhope.com/issues/ch000838.htm)
    - [ ] backup ~/Library/Application Support/AppCodeVV/ (one folder per v.v version)
        - see UNIX sort, [ how to get the first word of the string ](http://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/65932/how-to-get-the-first-word-of-a-string)
    - [ ] backup ~/Library/Preferences/AppCodeVV/ (one folder per v.v version)
- [ ] verify entire ~/Library/Preferences already on Crono-Sync backup list; make sure scheduled backups are running

title: Continuous Integration
body:
### Continuous Integration

*implement continuous integration for all Repositories and Targets*
    * *requires restructuring Xcode projects per #23*
*see "What's New in Xcode" 13#400@44:30*
- [x] add repositories to Xcode Accounts

*When we try to add a local repository, Xcode does not complain but does not add the repo. When we try to add a github repository, Xcode asks for username and password, then removes the name from the field and then says that "Authentication failed because the name or password was incorrect." new Mavericks volume; 02/05/14*

* working fine now, under Xcode 6 02/16/205*

- [ ] set up Xcode Server to handle continuous integration
to install server: [How to Install and Start Using OS X Server](http://computers.tutsplus.com/tutorials/how-to-install-and-start-using-os-x-server--mac-48261)
CI: [Xcode Continuous Integration Guide](https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/IDEs/Conceptual/xcode_guide-continuous_integration/000-About_Continuous_Integration/about_continuous_integration.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40013292-CH1-SW1)

###### for all Repositories / all Targets
- [ ] if applicable, new target installer script <TargetName>_build.py
- [ ] document steps fora testing and analysis process
- [ ] add bots for each step in testing and analysis process

###### add missing tests types
- [ ] AppleScript Testing #35
- [ ] validate HTML for documentation targets; see  #51
